description: |-
  Validate that a string is a valid semantic version range expression.
---

# function: semver_range

Returns true when the input string represents a valid SemVer range, e.g., '>=1.0.0,<2.0.0'.

## Example Usage

```terraform
terraform {
  required_providers {
    validatefx = {
      source  = "The-DevOps-Daily/validatefx"
      version = "0.0.1"
    }
  }
}

provider "validatefx" {}

locals {
  ranges = {
    single_ge     = ">=1.2.3"
    bounded_open  = ">=1.2.3, <2.0.0"
    with_v_prefix = ">=v1.0.0,<=v1.5.0"
  }

  results = {
    for name, expr in local.ranges : name => provider::validatefx::semver_range(expr)
  }
}

output "semver_range_validation" {
  value = local.results
}
```

## Signature

<!-- signature generated by tfplugindocs -->
```text
semver_range(value string) bool
```

## Arguments

<!-- arguments generated by tfplugindocs -->
1. `value` (String, Nullable) String value to validate.
